column4: hello, i have a remote connection to a server via ssh. i am running an application with GUI on that server but i want to see the GUI on my PC. what can i do?
i tried "export DISPLAY=MYIP:0"
but nothing happened when i ran the program
no
i just used -l
to login
hmm
ok
you cant connect to a running gui-program with ssh, just start a new gui-program and see it local, for that you have to use "ssh -X host"
oh ok
if i run "ssh -X host " and run the GUI program on remote server
where will i be able to see it
if you have used ssh -X e.g. if you are starting firefox on that host, you see it on your local machine
will it be directly seen on my host or will it be seen after i do switching or something like that?
directly
okay
if "X-Forwarding" is enabled in the ssh-config of the server (but imo its enabled by default in ubuntu)
hmm, the remote server is scientific-linux
but it should be enabled since other people also use
really for?
and others, thank you for your help, it worked
